email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your recent inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, available for a laycan of October 15-20. The vessel has a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 250 meters. The starting freight rate is in the low 50s, say $50.50 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit on the higher side. Would you consider $49.75 per metric ton? Also, can you confirm the laytime and demurrage terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I can offer $50.00 per metric ton, which is a competitive rate given the current market. Laytime is 72 hours total, and demurrage is set at $20,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, $50.00 sounds reasonable. Can we lock in the laycan for October 15-20? Also, please confirm the vessel’s readiness and any additional terms. I’ll need to finalize this by tomorrow. Thanks, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great to hear. The laycan is confirmed for October 15-20, and the MV Ocean Star is ready for loading. I’ll send over the fixture recap shortly. Let me know if you need anything else. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the confirmation. I’ve reviewed the fixture recap, and everything looks good. Let’s proceed with the agreement. Looking forward to a smooth operation. Cheers, John
